I did it again.

>{{champion:245}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:27}} {{champion:26}} 

wat?
Ekko uses a bat, which if you watch Walking Dead you know is a lethal weapon.
Ekko doesnt use a bat, he uses a clockhand.
I mean that might be what he made it out of, but he very clearly uses it like a bat. He even hits a (chrono)ball with it with his W!

If you use a pipe as a cup is it a cup?

No

https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0014/1962/products/pipemug_photo3.jpg?v=1320366565

Apparently yes.

It's kinda hard to respond to this because pipe is an ambiguous noun. That being said if you took something and made modifications to it to have a different purpose and used it for that purpose, then that is changing what it is.

....yes. 

Things like cups are determined partially by function, usage, and intended use. If a pipe is changed, modified, or designed to function as a cup, and the user uses it as a cup, then yes - for all intents and purposes, it is a cup. 

If Ekko's clockhand is designed similar to a bat, fufills the purpose of a bat, and he uses it like a bat, then yes - it is a bat. While calling it a bat severely undermines its potential, but it isnt wrong. Its like calling Iron Man's suit a piece of armor, or Mjolnir a hammer.
So if I used your shirt as a towel, it's a towel?

I would say yes. In function at least, my shirt fufils the same functions of a towel. So if you use my shirt as a towel, isnt it a towel for you? 

Its even clearer if you modify it to function better as a towel - if you cut up my shirt into a rectangular piece with all the frills and stuff of a towel, isnt it no longer a shirt? 

It seems like Ekko took the clockhand off of a clock. Its  a piece of a clock if it no longer functions as a time-telling device, being used as a bat. For all intents and purposes, its a bat. If you called it, "Ekko's Clock-hand," players without knowledge of its origin would be confused. However, if you call it, "Ekko's Bat," everybody who played as/against Ekko would know that youre referring to his weapon.

Gnars boomerang isn't that lethal unless you are taking into consideration his snow day skin where it is an ice pick
you've obviously never heard of captain boomerang... just his name alone is enough to kill
I have I know he is an enemy of the flash, I think. But being hit with a boomerang isnt going to hurt as much if it is just made of bone compared to a gun or sword.

Uh ... depends on the boomerang.

And how hard you throw it.
Considering the speed it flys when gnar throws it, it is not enough force to be that lethal. If it was someone else like captain boomerang or batman then yes it is fricking lethal lol.

Alright, point conceeded.

By the way, throwing cards can be [quite painful](https://youtu.be/RFPQO5jdKjE).

Yes I know, but you have to know how to throw them properly. I spent some time throwing cards with one of my college friends to see how far we could throw them. Twisted Fate is not the only one to have weaponized cards lol Kiba from yu-gi-oh! also weaponized cards. I am not going to look up how old that show is cause I do not want to feel old lol.
